div.p: Mr. Sewall's DISCOURSE Occaſion'd by the DEATH OF HIS FATHER.
THE Orphan's beſt Legacy: OR, GOD's Parental Care OF Bereaved Children: A DISCOURSE Occaſion'd By the DEATH of the HONOURABLE Samuel Sewall Es;q Who departed this Life, Jan. 1. 1729, 30 Aetatis 78.
By His Son, Joſeph Sewall, Paſtor of the South Church in Boſton.
div.q: Can a woman forget 〈…〉 child, that ſhe ſhould not have compaſſion on the ſon of her womb? yea, they may forget, yet will I not forget thee.
Doubtleſs thou art our father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, & Iſrael acknowledge us not: thou O LORD, art our father, our redeemer, thy name is from everlaſting.
div.p: BOSTON: Printed by B. Green: Sold by S. Gerriſh and D. Henchman, at their Shops. 1730.

div.head: The Orphans beſt Legacy.

epigraph.q: WHEN my Father and my Mother forſake me, then the LORD will take me up.

div.p: THE Title of this Pſalm informs us who was the inſpired Penman, King David: In it he encourageth himſelf in the LORD under his extreme dangers from his Enemies, and eſpecially from Saul. v. 1. The Lord is my light, the author of my joy, and my ſalvation, whom ſhall I fear —: And alſo offers to GOD his earneſt requeſts for help and ſuccour, as in the verſe before my Text. Hide not thy face far from me — leave me not —. And theſe words may be brought in as an argument to enforce his Petition from the conſideration of his preſent ſtate, That of an Orphan, who ſtood in great need of help; or for the encouragement of his faith, to truſt in that GOD with whom the Fatherleſs find Mercy.

In the words we have, 1. A ſorrowful caſe ſuppoſed, When my Father —. 〈◊〉
reads it, Becauſe my Father — ſo it is an argument to enforce his Petition, that GOD would not leave him, nor forſake him. Piſcator
and Mollerus read it, Altho'—. Our reading is, When: and thus Calvin.

2. We have his relief under this ſorrow, Then the LORD will take me up: Receive, or gather me. Now we don't read that David's Parents did ever deſert him, tho' we find them ſo unable to help him, and ſo unfit to attend his Marches, that David deſires of the King of Moab, that they might be with him till he ſhould know what GOD would do for him, 1 Sam. 22.3. Accordingly, ſome Expoſitors take the words as ſignifying all humane helps under the Name of Parents, by which we may underſtand all Councils and Helps for ſafety. Or, as others ſuppoſe, His Parents had departed this life; in which ſenſe I wou'd now conſider the words. However it was, David was now like an Orphan, in an helpleſs condition as to humane views and means, and accordingly he by faith realizeth GOD's Parental care and love, who, as He is ever able to help His People, ſo hath the bowels of a Father yerning towards them under their diſtreſſes; yea, more than the compaſſions of the tender Mother. Then the LORD, the Name given to GOD here is JEHOVAH, which ſignifies GOD's Eternal Self-exiſtence, and His giving Being to all Creatures. The fathers of our fleſh are Mortal, and muſt in a little time forſake us, if we are not taken from them firſt; but GOD the Everlaſting Father lives for ever to take care of His People. Shall take me up, or gather me. When Parents are remov'd, the Family is ordinarily ſcattered & broken up; but
then GOD will gather the Children of His People, and be a dwelling place to them.

div.head: DOCT. It is the great Privilege of the Children of GOD, that when their beſt Friends and Helpers on Earth, their Fathers and Mothers forſake them, He will take them up.

list.item: I. Our Fathers and Mothers muſt forſake us.
II. It is the Privilege of GOD's Children, that He will then take them up.

div.head: Prop. I. Our beſt Friends on Earth, our Fathers and our Mothers muſt forſake us.
div.p:
GOD alone can ſay to us and fulfil that His word, I will never leave thee, nor forſake thee. Our choiceſt friends here are, as we, frail, mortal Creatures. For what is your life? it is even a vapour that appeareth for a little time, and then vaniſheth away. Your Fathers where are they? — Zech. 1.5. They are no more in this World; they are gone to their long home, to the houſe appointed for all living; and the Places which once knew them ſhall know them no more. Accordingly, when the godly depart this life, they are ſaid to be gathered to their People. Thus Abraham died in a good old Age, and was gathered to his People, Gen. 2 • .8. When the Saints die out of this World, they are born into the other. Their bodies indeed are left behind; however, the condition of theſe is ſuch when the Spirits that animated them are gone, that we muſt
bury them out of ſight. And as their bodies reſt in their Graves, ſo their Spirits return to GOD who gave them. When they leave our Society on Earth they go to the heavenly Jeruſalem, to the Spirits of juſt Men made perfect, and to Jeſus the Mediator of the new Covenant. Here a little to confirm & illuſtrate this Head, I may ſay, 1. All Men are ſubject to the law of Mortality, and muſt be remov'd out of this World by Death. 2. According to the courſe of Nature Parents forſake their Children, and leave them behind in this World, when they depart out of it by Death.

1. All Men are ſubject to the law of Mortality, and muſt be remov'd out of this World by Death. There is a Statute of Heaven for it, Heb. 9.27. — It is appointed unto Men once to die —. Indeed the LORD of Life hath made, and will make exceptions to this general rule. Thus Enoch and Elijah under the old Teſtament, were tranſlated, that they ſhould not ſee death. (And ſurely it was a great favour of GOD to the departed Spirits of the Saints, ſo early to give them an Example of the glorious beauty and perfection which their bodies ſhould be advanced to at the Reſurrection Enoch was tranſlated, A. M. 987. B. Uſuer. .) And the Apoſtle informs us that the People of GOD, who ſhall be found alive at our Saviour's coming to raiſe the dead, Shall not ſleep, (i.e. die) but be changed, 1 Cor. 15.51, 52. However this is the common lot. Pſal. 89.48. What man is he that liveth, and ſhall not ſee death?
No ſooner had Man ſinn'd but Death had power over him, and began to work towards a diſſolution of this earthly frame. Gen. 2.17. — In the day thou eateſt thereof, thou ſhall ſurely die. And it is plain from Scripture that this Threatning Extends to Adam's Poſterity: Rom. 5.12. Wherefore, as by one man ſin entred into the World, and death by ſin; and ſo death paſſed upon all men, for that all have ſinned. Men are various ways diſtinguiſh'd in the World into high and low, rich and poor, young and old, but in this reſpect they are all upon a level, equally ſubject to death. And this the Experience of all Ages teacheth. One Generation paſſeth away, and another cometh; — Eccl. 1.4. Rom. 5.14. — Death reigned from Adam to Moſes, even over them that had not ſinn'd after the ſimilitude of Adam's tranſgreſſion—. As infants who have not been guilty of Actual tranſgreſſion committed in their own perſons, and yet the ſentence of the law takes hold of them, an undediable evidence that Adam's firſt ſin is imputed to them; and that we all bring a corrupt Nature into the World with us. It is true, the Children of GOD are deliver'd from the ſting and curſe of death by JESUS CHRIST, who by dying hath conquered this laſt Enemy; ſo that they ſhall all Triumph, and ſay, O death, where is thy ſling? O grave, where is thy victory? 1 Cor. 15.55. However, GOD will have them alſo taſte of this bitter cup as a teſtimony of His displeaſure againſt their ſin, and as a means of purging away the remains of
it, that they may be preſented without ſpot before Him. They muſt paſs thro' this Jordan before they obtain Reſt in the heavenly Canaan. Their Faith in JESUS CHRIST, and other Graces may help them to die well; but will not exempt them from the ſtroke of death: Heb. 11.13. Theſe all died in faith —. They muſt this way, thro' the valley of the ſhadow of death, follow the Captain of their Salvation to Glory. They muſt be bro't down to the duſt in order to their being exalted to ſit with Him on Thrones in His Fathers Kingdom. Their warfare is not accompliſhed till they have encountred this Enemy, nor can they ſay, It is finiſhed, until, with our Saviour, They give up the Ghoſt. Thus died Moſes the Servant of the LORD. Thus David after he had ſerved his generation according to the will of GOD, fell a ſleep, & was laid to his Fathers —. The matter of Fact which the Jews alledged was true, tho' miſapplied, Joh. 8.52. — Abraham is dead, and the Prophets—. Accordingly, when our Saviour aſſerts, If any man keep my ſaying, he ſhall never ſee death, v. 51. He muſt be underſtood of the ſecond death, which is eternal, comprehending the deſtruction of Soul and Body in Hell. Now, by death we are remove'd out of this World, agreably death is call'd a departure, 2 Tim. 4. 6. — The time of my departure is at hand. The Soul goeth forth out of the Body, the vital union between them being diſſolvd'd. Gen. 35.18. — As her ſoul was in departing, for ſhe died —. And the Body is then carried to the Grave, the Houſe appointed
for all the living. Death diſſolveth the Union, and breaks off the Society there was between the neareſt Relations; they are ſeparated forever as to what concerns this life, which leads me to ſay,

2. According to the Courſe of Nature Parents forſake their Children, and leave them behind in this World; when they depart out of it by death. Indeed, it is no uncommon thing to have this order of Nature inverted. We read that of old, Haran died before his Father Terah, i. e. "In his ſight and preſence, he being yet alive, Gen. 11. 28. Thus Aaron, Job, David, &c. ſurviv'd to bewail the loſs of Children. And alas! how common is this in our day? Upon this account among others the land of darkneſs may be ſaid to be without order, Job 10. 22. The young and ſtrong have the precedency oftentimes, and go to the Grave before the aged and infirm. The lamp of life is not ſeldom blown out. Diſeaſes & Accidents, as we call them, tho' all under the government of GOD's Providence, often put a period to lives which might endure much longer. We die ſooner or later according to the will of the Sovereign GOD, who hath determined our Days on Earth in His Decree, & appointed our bounds which we cannot paſs. Job 14.5. Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou haſt appointed his bounds that he cannot paſs. However, according to the courſe of Nature, as Parents are born into the World firſt, ſo they die out of it before their Children. The decays of Nature
and infirmities of Age gradually grow upon them; we ſee them decline and wear away under the fatigues and burdens of life, until, as the Candle burns down and goeth out, ſo the vital heat and moiſture being conſum'd, they expire. Pſal. 90.10. The days of our years are threeſcore years and ten; and if by reaſon of ſtrength they be fourſcore years, yet is their ſtrength labour and ſorrow: for it is ſoon cut off, and we fly away. This hath been accounted the Age of Man ſince Moſes's time. Here alſo we may obſerve, That it is no ſtrange thing for Parents to be taken away in their full ſtrength, yea, even before middle Age, and ſo to leave their Children Young, ſometimes not capable of underſtanding the greatneſs of their loſs; but then, others by the favour of GOD continue till their Children are grown up, and after that they have for ſome time experienc'd the great benefit of their Preſence, Counſels and Prayers, the Parents die and leave them to lament their loſs. And the pious Parent may when leaving this World, ſay to ſurvivours, ſomething as our Saviour to the daughters of Jeruſalem; — Weep not for me, but for your ſelves Luck 23, 28.. For when ſuch depart, they go to be with CHRIST, which is far better; they go out of a World of ſin and ſorrow to that better Country, which is an heavenly, where they are comforted in the glorious Preſence of the Lamb, having all tears wiped from their Eyes, and being made perfect in holineſs. The Day of their
death is better to them than the day of their birth. But then, by ſuch a bereaving Providence, GOD calls us to lament and mourn; for they are gone from us, and that not to return again to converſe with us here. We ſee their faces no more; we behold their exemplary Converſation no more, receive their Inſtructions and help no more. And therefore ſuch a Bereavement ought to be lamented, even tho' our Parents ſhould live to a good old Age: When their hoary heads which were a Crown of Glory, being found in the way of righteouſneſs, are laid in the duſt, We may well take up a lamentation, and ſay, the Crown is fallen — for the glory of children are their fathers, Prov. 17.6. However, the Children of GOD have this Conſolation when exerciſed with ſuch Bereavements, that tho' their Fathers are not, yet the GOD of their Fathers lives to take care of them, and fulfil the promiſes of His Everlaſting Covenant: Which brings me to,

div.head: Prop. II. It is the great Privilege of GOD's Children, that when their Fathers and Mothers forſake them, He will take them up.
div.p:
GOD is the everlaſting Father, and in CHRIST JESUS the Father of Mercies, and the GOD of all Conſolations to His Covenant-People. They that receive the eternal Son of GOD by faith, have power to become the ſons of GOD Joh. 1. 12. "They are received into this
happy number, and have a right to the precious Privileges of ſuch: They have the Spirit of Adoption, whereby they cry, Abba Father, and GOD pitieth them, as a father pitieth his Children. Yea, GOD hath more than the compaſſions of the tender Mother: Iſai. 49.5. Can a woman forget her ſucking child, that ſhe ſhould not have compaſſion on the ſon of her womb? Yea, they may forget, yet will I not forget thee. The love of the Mother, the more tender Sex towards her Offspring, is a ſtrong and conſtant affection indeed, eſpecially while the child hangs at her Breaſt; yet ſuch are the moral and natural infirmities of humane Nature ſince the Fall, that even ſhe may forget — but GOD remembers His Children with an everlaſting Love, and is accordingly always ready to ſuccour them under their ſorrows, with the moſt tender compaſſion. Iſai. 66.13. As one whom his Mother comforteth, ſo will I comfort you —. Our Lord JESUS CHRIST was with His Diſciples as the Father of the Family while on Earth, and when the time of His departure drew nigh, one of the good words He ſpake to them was that, Joh. 14.18. I will not leave you comfortleſs —: In the Original it is, Orphans, bereaved ones: When about to leave this World, as to His bodily preſence, He committed them to the care and protection of their heavenly Father. Joh. 17.11. Holy Father keep thro' thine own Name, thoſe whom thou haſt given me —. And to ſpeak more directly of earthly Parents and Anceſtors; the People of GOD comfort themſelves from this conſideration:
Iſai. 63.16. Doubtleſs thou art our Father, though Abraham be ignorant of us, and Iſrael acknowledge us not: thou O LORD, art our father, our redeemer, thy name is from everlaſting. Upon which a worthy Expoſitor obſerveth, "That they own themſelves Fatherleſs, if He be not their Father, and ſo caſt themſelves upon Him with whom the Fatherleſs findeth mercy, Hoſ. 14.3. It was the honour of their Nation that they had Abraham to their Father, Mat. 3.9. who was the friend of GOD; and Iſrael, who was a Prince with GOD; but what the better were they for that, unleſs they had GOD Himſelf for their Father; for Abraham and Iſrael can't help them, they have not the power that GOD hath, they are dead long ſince, and are ignorant of us, and acknowledge us not, they know not what our caſe is, nor what our wants are, and therefore know not which way to do us a kindneſs —. But thou O LORD art our Father ſtill. The fathers of our fleſh may call themſelves Ever Loving, but not Ever Living; it is GOD only that is the immortal Father, that always knows us, and is never at a diſtance from us, and therefore our Redeemer, from everlaſting is thy Name, the Name by which we will know and own thee, it is the Name by which from of old thou haſt been known; Thy People have always look'd upon thee as the GOD to whom they might appeal to right them, and plead their cauſe" Henry

I would here very briefly ſpeak to a few particulars, further to ſhew the Privilege of the Children of GOD contain'd in that good word, The LORD will take me up: which word in the Original is obſerv'd to be uſed of taking up and bringing home a ſtray ſheep: Deut. 22.1, 2.

1. When Father and Mother forſake, GOD will as a tender Father take up his People, own them as of His Family, and treat them as his Children. GOD will take them up, and receive them under His Roof. Children are wont to gather to their Fathers Houſe, while their Parents live to enjoy their Company, take their Advice, and receive their bleſſing, &c. Accordingly, when their Parents are removed by death, the LORD who is a dwelling place to His People in all Generations, will grant them Reſt and Shelter by His gracious Preſence with them, and the care of His good Providence over them. They ſhall abide under the ſhadow of the Almighty, and that not ſolitary, but having Him as a tender Father ready to aſſiſt and comfort them. GOD will not caſt them off at ſuch a time, No! but will fulfil that word to them, Heb. 13.5. I will never leave thee, nor forſake thee. The Scripture refer'd to is ſuppos'd to be GOD's word to Joſhua after Moſes's death, Joſh. 1.5. I will not fail thee, nor forſake thee. With this David encouraged his Son Solomon, when the time of his departure drew nigh, 1 Chron. 28.20. And David ſaid to Solomon his ſon, Be ſtrong, and of good courage, and do
it: fear not, nor be diſmayed, for the LORD GOD, even my GOD, will be with thee, he will not fail thee, nor forſake thee — When this trouble is near, GOD will not ſtand afar off, but will be found their preſent help. He will ſay to them, Fear not, for I am with thee, be not diſmayed, for I am thy GOD, I will ſtrengthen thee, yea I will help thee, yea I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteouſneſs Iſai 41.10.. They ſhall have freedom of acceſs to GOD, and may pour out their Complaints before Him with the liberty of Children; and GOD will hear them when bemoaning themſelves as Ephraim, under His correcting hand, and give that gracious anſwer, Jer. 31.20. Is Ephraim my dear ſon? is he a pleaſant child? for ſince I ſpake againſt him, I do earneſtly remember him ſtill: therefore my bowels are troubled for him; I will ſurely have mercy upon him, ſaith the LORD. This the word of GOD further declareth to us, that thro' the patience & comfort of the Scriptures we might have hope: Pſal. 103 13—18. Like as a father pitieth his children: ſo the LORD pitieth them that fear him. For he knoweth our frame: he remembreth that we are duſt. As for man, his days are as graſs: as a flower the field, ſo be flouriſheth. For the wind paſſeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof ſhall know it no more. But the mercy of the LORD is from everlaſting to everlaſting upon them that fear him: and his
righteouſneſs unto childrens children. To ſuch as keep his covenant, and to thoſe that remember his commandments to do them. Now, GOD's owning & treating His People as Children may comprehend the particulars which follow, however, I ſhall diſtinctly conſider them.

2. GOD will take them up, direct & conduct them in the ways which ſhall be pleaſing to Him, and profitable for them. One great advantage we receive from wiſe and good Parents is their Advice & Counſel. "Some of the Ancients ſay, that the word Pupil, which is from the Latin, ſignifieth, One without ſight, or wanting the apple or pupil of his Eyes; becauſe being depriv'd of his Parents, he wants the light of counſel and direction, to carry him on in his courſe thro' this World. What Moſes ſpake to Hobab his father in law, is a truth of all good Parents to their Children, "They are to them in ſtead of eyes, Numb. 10.31" Caryl. on Job 6. 27. But now, when their eyes are clos'd by death, and their thoughts periſh, GOD will direct His People, and guide them by His counſel. He who is the Father of Lights with whom is no variableneſs, neither ſhadow of turning, will enlighten their darkneſs, and guide them with His Eye. When Children are thus bereaved, they are often in great perplexity, not knowing what to do: Jer. 10.23. — The way of man is not in himſelf: it is not in man to direct his ſteps. The People of GOD are convinc'd of this truth, and accordingly obey that command, Pſal. 37.5.
Commit thy way unto the Lord: — And find by happy experience that it is a command with promiſe. Prov. 3.6. In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he ſhall direct thy paths. When thus forſaken, the Spirit of Adoption moves them to cry to the Eternal GOD, as, Jer. 3.4. My Father, Thou art the guide of my Youth. And GOD's ear is open to their cry. He will by the care of His watchful Providence, and by the influence of His Word & Spirit effectually ſay to them, This is the way, walk ye in it, when they may be ready to turn to the right hand or to the left; ſo that they ſhall make no fatal miſtakes, nor be loſt in that path which leads to deſtruction. As to what concerns their Souls welfare, which is the One thing needful, GOD will guide them with his counſel, and afterward receive them to glory Pſal. 73. And as to what concerns their temporal Affairs, GOD will enable them to guide theſe with diſcretion, or ſo over-rule even their miſtakes, as that all things ſhall work together for their good Pſal. 112.5. Rom 8 28..

3. GOD will take them up to help, defend and provide for them. Parents are a great help and protection to their Children, however, when GOD's People are bereav'd of thoſe earthly helpers, they ſhall not be left naked & expos'd. No. Pſal. 115.11. The Lord is their help and their ſhield. Pſal. 10.14. —The poor committeth himſelf unto thee, thou art the helper of the fatherleſs. GOD will be their guardian and protector, ſo that they may boldly ſay,
Heb. 13.6. The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man ſhall do unto me. When Children are forſaken of their Parents, the Men of the World many times take the advantage to oppreſs them. Job complains, Ye overwhelm the fatherleſs, chap. 6.27. But now, GOD will ſtand on their ſide, and if any injure them, He will reſent and avenge it. Jer. 2.3.— All that devour him, ſhall offend: — ſaith the LORD. GOD hath forbidden us to afflict any Widow, or fatherleſs Child whatſoever, Exod. 22.22. And aſſureth us that if they cry to Him under ſuch affliction, He will hear their cry, v. 23. How much rather will He hear when His Covenant-Children cry to Him under ſuch oppreſſion, and fulfil the threatning which follows: v. 24. My wrath ſhall wax hot, and I will kill you with the ſword; and your wives ſhall be widows, and your children fatherleſs. GOD is their Judge, and He will do them right. Pſal. 10.18. To judge the fatherleſs, and the oppreſſed, that the man of the earth may no more oppreſs. It is one of His Titles as it were, whereby He makes Himſelf known to us, Pſal. 146.9. The Lord relieveth the fatherleſs and widow. When they may be moſt deſtitute of humane aid, then will GOD be nigh to them, and incompaſs them with His favour as with a ſhield. Now they may ſing as Pſal. 121.5. The Lord is thy keeper: the Lord is thy ſhade upon thy right hand. v. 7. The Lord ſhall preſerve thee from all evil: he ſhall preſerve thy ſoul. Yea, they ſhall not only be defended from evil; but be well provided for and ſupplied with that
good which GOD ſhall ſee moſt needful & ſuitable for them: their heavenly Father, who knoweth that they have need of theſe things, will give them bread to eat, and raiment to put on, until they are brought to His Houſe which is eternal in the Heavens. David ſays, Pſal. 37.25. I have been young, and now am old, yet have I not ſeen the righteous forſaken, nor his ſeed begging bread. He had not, it may be, obſerv'd the pious Children of godly Parents brought to begging; and tho' it is not uncommon now for GOD's Children to be poor in this World, yet they are not forſaken when brought thus low; no, GOD hath often given remarkable inſtances of His fatherly care of ſuch as have had ſcarce any viſible means of ſupport. He that hears the Ravens when they cry, and feeds them, will not ſuffer His Covenant People to want the good things of this life which are proper for them; when they pray, as directed by their Lord & Saviour, Give us this day our daily bread. How ſtrongly doth the Apoſtle argue, Rom. 8.32. He that ſpared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how ſhall he not with him alſo freely give us all things? Let the bereaved be left in ever ſuch poor and diſtreſſed circumſtances, GOD's promiſe muſt be fulfill'd, Pſal. 84.11. The LORD God is a fun and ſhield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.

4. GOD will take them up, and Comfort them under ſuch a Bereavement. Pious Parents are dear to ſuch Children, and their loſs in
them is in a manner irreparable as to the Creature: who will, who can do for us as our Fathers that begat us, and our Mothers that bear us? GOD hath implanted in them a ſtrong and almoſt invincible affection towards the Offspring of their bodies, themſelves multiplied; ſo that they ſcarce think any thing too much to do or ſuffer for them: And their removal by death is often attended with peculiar difficulties. Agreably, we have that expreſſion of diſtreſſing ſorrow, Pſal. 35.14. I bowed down heavily, as one that mourneth for his Mother. But when they are in this mournful ſtate, deſolate & forſaken, GOD will viſit them, and ſpeak comfortably to them; He will ſit as One that comforteth the Mourners. Our Lord JESUS CHRIST who knows how to ſpeak a word in ſeaſon to them that are weary, and hath been anointed with the oyl of gladneſs above His fellows, will give unto theſe mourners in Zion, beauty for aſhes, the oyl of joy for mourning Pſal. 45.7. Iſai. 61.3. There are many good words ſpoken to His People in the Scriptures, by which He revives the ſpirits of theſe mourners, when He pleaſeth. Pſal. 68.5. A father of the fatherleſs, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation. Joh. 11.25. — I am the reſurrection, and the life. Matt. 9.2. — Son, be of good cheer, thy ſins be forgiven thee. Joh. 14.27. Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
1 Theſ. 4.13, 14. Heb. 13.5. I will never leave thee —. And by His good Spirit, the Comforter, He makes His word a word of life and comfort to their Souls.

5. GOD will take them up, and Sanctify ſuch Bereavement to them for ſaving good. How grievous ſoever the Chaſtening may be for the preſent, yet ſhall it yield to them the peaceable fruit of righteouſneſs. When GOD chaſtiſeth them it is in meaſure, as a Father His Children. And by ſuch afflictions GOD humbleth and proves them and doth them good for their latter end; ſo that they have reaſon to ſay with him, Pſal. 119.71. It is good for me that I have been afflicted —. Their iniquity is purged, their faith and patience are tryed and improv'd, and they grow in the experience of GOD's fatherly care & pity towards them, which muſt be for their great profit & advantage.

6. GOD will give them the Inheritance of Children, and take them up to dwell with Him for ever in Heaven. Rom. 8.17. If children, then heirs; heirs of God, & joynt-heirs with Chriſt. GOD Himſelf will be their Portion, and fulfill the precious Promiſes of the New-Covenant to them: Pſal. 16.5. The LORD is the portion of mine inheritance, and of my cup: thou maintaineſt my lot. They have choſen Him as their Portion, and GOD hath given Himſelf to them as their GOD and Father in CHRIST, & will accordingly bleſs them with all ſpiritual Bleſſings in heavenly things; yea, GOD will bleſs them indeed, even in the good things of this life, which their earthly Parents leave them; for
He gives theſe things to His choſen People, being mindful of His Covenant; and hence it is that a little which a righteous man hath, is better than the riches of many wicked, Pſal. 37.16. In a word, GOD will not leave them, until he hath done that which he hath ſpoken to them of Gen. 28.15.; and put them into the full poſſeſſion of all that good which is contain'd in the Promiſes of which they are the Heirs. GOD will be their guide to death, and when they fail here will receive them to the everlaſting Habitations which He hath prepar'd for them in Heaven, where they ſhall have a perfect deliverance from all evil, and the poſſeſſion of all good in the full and everlaſting enjoyment of GOD the chief good; where they ſhall meet their godly Parents gone before never to part again, and have every dark Providence clear'd up to their abundant ſatisfaction. Joh. 14.2, 3. In my fathers houſe are many manſions; if it were not ſo, I would have told you: I go to prepare a place for you. And if I go & prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto my ſelf, that where I am, there ye may be alſo. As Children, they ſhall dwell in in the Houſe of the LORD for ever, and there will GOD make the ſulleſt manifeſtations of His fatherly love to them. Agreably, in our Verſion of the ſinging Pſalms, the words are thus rendred. Yet will JEHOVAH gathering, unto Himſelf me take. And ſurely they need no more to compleat their happineſs: Ever to be with the LORD, is to be eternally bleſſed.

div.head: APPLICATION
div.p: USE I. Muſt our Fathers & Mothers forſake us, ſee here what an evil & bitter thing ſin is, by the fruit of it. It is a root of bitterneſs bearing wormwood & gall. It kills even them that were moſt dear to us, and ſeparates the neareſt Relations; it puts lover & friend far from us, and our Acquaintance into darkneſs. It is ſin that hath brought miſery and death into the World. Rom. 6.23. The wages of ſin is death. O let us then turn from all ſin as the abominable thing which our ſouls hate: Let us under ſuch Bereavements, mourn for our 〈◊〉 with that godly ſorrow which worketh Repentance, and ſo fly from them unto JESUS CHRIST, who ſaves his People from their ſins: Bleſſed are they who thus mourn; for they ſhall be comforted.

II. Muſt our Fathers & Mothers forſake us; Then we ſhould prize them and do our Duty towards them while we enjoy them; and humble our ſelves under GOD's correcting Hand, when they are taken from us. We are very much oblig'd to our Parents: In them GOD hath made a wife and gracious proviſion for our continuance & comfort in the World; Indeed earthly Fathers are but the fathers of our fleſh, which is alſo GOD's Creature; GOD is the Father of Spirits, He forms the Spirit of Man within him; however, they are inſtruments in GOD's hand, of our being and
well being here. What creature ſo helpleſs as Man in his Infant ſtate? In anſwer to which, we have the tender love & care of our Parents: Thus did GOD make us to hope when we were upon our Mother's breaſts, who muſt have periſh'd if left to our ſelves. Many and great are the benefits which we receive from our Parents, eſpecially from pious Parents both relating to this and a better life, in our comfortable Subſiſtance, early Dedication to GOD, Education, &c. Certainly then, we ſhould highly eſteem and dearly love them; we ſhould honour and obey them in the LORD, as the fifth Commandment requireth, which is the firſt Commandment "with a ſpecial Promiſe of life and proſperity" annexed to it. Eph. 6. 〈◊〉
Honour thy father and mother, (which is the firſt commandment with promiſe) That it may be well with thee, and thou mayſt live long on the earth. And if they live to ſtand in need of our help thro' the infirmities of age, or upon other accounts, We ſhould ſhew piety at home, and requite our Parents: for that is good and acceptable before God, 1 Tim. 5.4. And when GOD removes them from us by death, we ſhould ſee His hand ſtretched out againſt us, and humble our ſelves under it; we ſhould neither deſpiſe the Chaſtiſement of the LORD, nor yet ſaint when rebuked of Him; but be in ſubjection to the Father of Spirits that we may live, and enjoy His preſence with us when our earthly Parents forſake us. And therefore, as it hath pleaſed GOD to take my aged and honoured Father from my head, whoſe memory
will ever be precious to me; I beſeech you, Brethren, that ye ſtrive together with me in your Prayers to GOD for me; that I may be enabled ſo to attend theſe Duties, as to give glory to GOD, and to be an Enſample to the Flock. I acknowlege my ſelf unworthy of the honour & privilege I enjoy'd in ſuch a Parent, and wou'd abaſe my ſelf before the LORD, that I made no better improvement of my advantages, eſpecially on ſpiritual accounts: And while I cry after him, my Father, my Father, the chariot of Iſrael, and the horſemen thereof I wou'd earneſtly ſeek to GOD our heavenly Father, that the Spirit which was on him may be given unto me, that I may exalt 〈◊〉 Father's GOD, and follow His Servant as he followed JESUS CHRIST. May the LORD be the GOD and Judge of the Widow; may He take up the Fatherleſs into the Arms of His everlaſting Mercy, and bleſs them with the Bleſſings of His well ordered & ſure Covenant: And may we all be followers of them who thro' faith and patience inherit the promiſes.

III.We ſhould be above all things concerned to make ſure of this, that the everlaſting Father is our GOD and Father in CHRIST JESUS. Our earthly Parents are mortal, and muſt be taken from us by death; but GOD is the ſame and His years fail not; He lives for ever the Hope of His Iſrael and the saviour thereof in all times of trouble: Let us then return to Him from whom we have departed by the Apoſtacy, confeſſing we have
ſinned in His Sight, and are unworthy to be called His Children; let us cry to Him to extend His fatherly pity and mercy to us in and by His beloved Son, whom in the fulneſs of time He ſent forth made of a woman, made under the law, to redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the Adoption of Sons, Gal. 4.4, 5. Let us by His Grace heartily conſent to receive JESUS CHRIST according to the New Covenent, then His Father will be our Father, and His GOD our GOD Joh 20. 17. Let us ask of GOD His Holy Spirit, that being born again, not of corruptible Seed, but of incorruptible by the word of GOD which liveth and abideth for ever, we may bear His Image, and bring forth that fruit whereby our heavenly Father ſhall be glorified. Let us reverence and honour, obey and ſubmit to Him in all things, and be followers of Him as dear Children: Then we may rejoyce in Him under all ſorrowful Bereavements, and ſay, The LORD lives, and bleſſed be my Rock. We may comfort ourſelves with theſe words, and be aſſur'd that what ever is taken from us, GOD Himſelf who is all in all, will never forſake us. He will come unto us, and make His abode with us while in this World, and when we ſhall be here no more, will receive us to His Houſe which is eternal in the Heavens, where we ſhall be for ever comforted in His Preſence, in whoſe Preſence is fulneſs of joy, and at whoſe right hand there are pleaſures for ever more.
IV. I wou'd cloſe the ſubject with a word of Exhortation, directed to Parents and Children.
I. To Parents, in a few particulars.
1. Be Exhorted, Early to Pray for your Children, and in this way commend them to be Care & Bleſſing of the Everlaſting Father.

It is one great Privilege which belongs to the Relation of Parents in Covenant with GOD, bleſs their Children in the Name of the LORD, by asking His Bleſſing for them. And ſurely the conſideration of your Mortality ſhould quicken you to begin this Duty ſo ſoon as you know they begin to live, and to continue inſtant in it with all perſeverance; for when you are remov'd, you will not be acquainted with their condition as now you are, and if faithful, will be taken up from them to Praiſe GOD in His Temple above. Now then, lay up a ſtock of Prayers for them which may come down in Bleſſings upon them, even after your deceaſe. You have been inſtrumental of conveying ſin and death to them. Pſal. 51.5. Behold, I was ſhapen in iniquity, and in ſin did my Mother conceive me. O cry to GOD then that they may experience the power of the New Birth, and that being cleanſed from their ſins by the Blood and Spirit of CHRIST, they may live to GOD here, and be prepared to follow you to Heaven, Thus
David pray'd for Solomon, 1 Chron. 29.19. Give unto Solomon my ſon a perfect heart to keep thy commandments —. Seeing you know not the day of your death, how ſoon and ſuddenly it may come upon you; attend this Duty daily, in ſecret, and in your families; yea, take them with you ſometimes in your Retirements, and let them ſee your concern for them in your ſervent Prayers to GOD on their behalf. Thus to attend your duty will be one likely way of enjoying them as Bleſſings of GOD to you while you live; and in this way, you may with the more comfortable aſſurance commit them to the care of the ever-living GOD, when you leave them at death.
2. Give them up to GOD in Baptiſm, and thus do your endeavour to bring them under the wing and bleſſing of the everlaſting Covenant eſtabliſh'd with GOD's People, and their Seed in CHRIST JESUS.
3. Teach them the Will of GOD, and call upon them to Chooſe that good Part which can't be taken away.

All fleſh is as graſs,— but the word of the LORD endureth for ever 1 Pet 1.24, 25.. O do your utmoſt then that they may know the Scriptures from their childhood, and have the laws of GOD written upon their hearts. Labour to inſtill the principles of Religion into them, and teach them early how they muſt fear and ſerve the LORD, while you look to GOD to fulfill His promiſe: Iſai. 54.13. All thy children ſhall be taught of the LORD—. Shew them their ſin and miſery by the Fall, and the only remedy provided in JESUS CHRIST, the only Name given among Men whereby we can be ſav'd. Call upon them to know the GOD of their Fathers, and to chooſe Him as their GOD. Urge them to make ſure of an Intereſt in CHRIST, and the Bleſſings of the Covenant; to Repent of their Sins, and make haſte to keep GOD's Commandments; that He may never leave them, and that in Him the unchangable GOD, they may have an unfailing Friend and everlaſting Portion. You
know not how ſoon you may be ſilent in the Grave: O do not delay then to ſpeak to them about the concerns of their Souls, and to teach them the good knowledge of the LORD, that they may be wiſe for Eternity & to Salvation!
4. Go before them, while GOD continueth you with them, in an holy Exemplary Converſation.

Walk before GOD within your houſe with a perfect heart, and before them, in a perfect way; for it is natural and common for Children to imitate their Parents. It is true, they ſtand in need of ſupernatural Grace, to enable them to follow your pious Examples; however, the duty is your's, and you muſt diſcharge it, looking to GOD to turn their feet to His Teſtimonies. Be exhorted then to ſet the great and weighty matters of GOD's law before your Children, not only in verbal Inſtructions, but in a living Pattern; that they may be encouraged to follow your faith, conſidering the end of your converſation. It may be you have but a little time to be with them, O endeavour then to do much, by living much to the honour of GOD, the little time that remains! Take heed you do not lay a ſtumbling-block before them by living in the Omiſſion of Duty, of Family-prayer, of the ſtrict Obſervation of the Lord's-day, of a devout Attendance on the Lord's Table, &c. Or, in the Commiſſion of Sin, of profaneſs, of intemperance, lying, diſhoneſty in dealing, &c. left they fall after
your Example, and GOD viſit the iniquity of the Fathers upon the Children. O do not walk in that broad way which leads to deſtruction, left they follow you, and you have a dreadful meeting in Hell; but in that narrow way which leads to life, that you may have a joyful meeting in Heaven.
5. Endeavour to leave your Children with GOD, when you forſake them; and do what you can that they may live in Peace among themſelves.

The great work we have to do when we come to die, is to commit our departing Spirits into the Hands of JESUS CHRIST, and ſo to reſign our lives to GOD by Him as a free-will Offering; but this is not all, we ſhou'd alſo commit our dear Relatives, and in particular our Children, to the care of the living GOD, when we are leaving them. If you underſtand that word as an exhortation and promiſe to GOD's People, it may be fitly applied here, Jer 49.11. Leave thy fatherleſs children, I will preſerve them alive, and let thy widows truſt in me. Now then commend them to GOD in a ſolemn manner, and if GOD give you the opportunity, Charge them to keep His Covenant, that they may happily find that GOD is the GOD of His People, and of their Seed in their Generations. And in order to their obtaining the gracious Preſence of GOD with them, you ſhou'd do what you can that they may dwell together in Unity; for thus runs the promiſe, 2 Cor
13.11. —Live in Peace: and the God of love and peace ſhall be with you. And here it may not be amiſs to ſay, prudently and ſeaſonably ſettle your Affairs, that there may be no occaſion of unhappy diviſion and alienation upon temporal accounts.

In a word, Whatever your hand finds to do for the welfare of your Children, do it with your might; for there is no work nor knowledge in the Grave whither you are going. If there be any Commands or Charges needful for you to give, and them to receive, delay them not, left you be prevented by Death. If you are middle Aged, you may not preſume you have time enough before you; for not a few die in their full ſtrength: And if GOD hath ſpared you to old Age, you had need make haſte to attend your duty in theſe & other reſpects, that when Death comes, you may take leave of your Children with a comfortable hope that GOD will take them up and bleſs them, as He did Iſaac after his Father's death, Gen. 25. 11. And it came to paſs after the death of Abraham, that God bleſſed his ſon Iſaac; and that you ſhall have a Seed to ſerve GOD on earth, when you are call'd up to Praiſe Him in Heaven.
II. Let the Exhortation be directed, to Children.
1. Be thankful to GOD if He continueth your Parents to you after you are grown up.

It is the ſorrowful caſe of many, that their Parents forſake them while very young: If it be otherwiſe with you, humbly bleſs GOD, and conſider how you may beſt ſhew your grateful ſenſe of ſuch a benefit, and improve it to the honour of GOD, and your own advantage. And remember, you are in an eſpecial. manner oblig'd thus to expreſs your thankfulneſs, if your Parents have not only ſome external reſemblance of GOD upon them, who is the Father of all, in the authority this Relation gives them over you; but alſo his moral Image in them, which is created in righteouſneſs and true holineſs: The preſence of ſuch Parents who have GOD graciouſly preſent with them, is a great ſavour indeed. Happy, thrice happy the Children! who are thus favour'd of the LORD, know their Privilege, and wiſely improve it.
2. Do your utmoſt that you may be Bleſſings and Comforts to them, while they live.

Altho' you are grown to years capable of chooſing & acting for your ſelves, and remov'd into diſtinct Families, yet your obligation to honour your Fathers and Mothers abides with the Relation; tho' indeed the authority of Parents and obedience of Children are to be exerciſed after a different manner: Do you then expreſs your filial duty in a manner becoming your riper Age, and labour to be helpful to
your Parents, even when you are remov'd from under their immediate care. Now endeavour to be under GOD their Staff, when they decline thro' age; and do what you can to ſweeten and brighten the evil days which are come upon them, by your good carriage. O deſpiſe them not when they are old; but ſuccour them under their infirmities, and let them now have ſome good fruit of their unwearied care and pains with you. Heavenly Father! forgive our ſinful defects for Thy Son's ſake, with whoſe perfect Obedience Thou waſt ever well pleaſed.
3. When your Parents forſake you, Look to GOD to take you up.

Prepare for ſuch a dark hour by taking care to give up your ſelves to the living GOD, as your GOD and Father, by receiving all the good you can from your Parents, and doing all the good you can to them, while you are continued to each other. Live under the realizing view of their and your own Mortality. Let their commands, and eſpecially their dying charges have great weight with you. And when they are taken from you, go to GOD in the Name of CHRIST, and depend on Him for all that light and grace, direction and help which you need. Thus you ſhall find Him the Father of Mercies to you; He will take you up, and make up your loſs in Himſelf, and in His CHRTST.
To fill up this vacant Page, the following HYMNS are added from the excellent Mr. WATTS.

div.head: Children devoted to GOD. Gen. 17.7, 10. Acts 16.14, 15, 33.

lg.l: THus ſaith the Mercy of the Lord,

l.hi: I'll be a God to thee;
I'll bleſs thy num'rous Race, and they
Shall be a Seed for me.

lg.l: Abraham believ'd the promis'd Grace,
And gave his Sons to God;
But Water ſeals the Bleſſing now,
That once was ſeal'd with Blood.
Thus Lydia ſanctify'd her Houſe
When ſhe receiv'd the Word;
Thus the believing Jaylor gave
His Houſhold to the Lord,
Thus later Saints, Eternal King,
Thine ancient Truth embrace;
To thee their Infant-Offspring bring,
And humbly claim the Grace.

div.head: Hope in the Covenant; or, GOD's Promiſe and Truth unchangeable, Heb. 6.17, —19.

lg.l: HOW oft have Sin and Satan ſtrove
To rend my Soul from thee, my God?
But everlaſting is thy Love,
And JESUS ſeals it with his Blood.
The Oath and Promiſe of the Lord
Joyn to confirm the wondrous Grace;
Eternal Power performs the Word,
And fills all Heav'n with endleſs Praiſe.
Amidſt Temptations ſharp and long
My Soul to this dear Refuge flies:
Hope is my Anchor, firm and ſtrong,
While Tempeſts blow and Billows riſe.
The Goſpel bears my Spirits up;
A faithful and unchanging God
Lays the Foundation for my Hope
In Oaths, and Promiſes, and Blood.
